level.text: Upon receipt of a properly completed application including photographs, fingerprints, and the required fee, the applicant shall be given a copy of the application form which indicates the fee has been paid.

The Director shall make any inquiry and investigation as he or she shall deem necessary to determine whether the applicant is entitled and qualified to receive a registration certificate, including the following:
Inquiry and investigation of the applicant’s criminal history;
Submission of fingerprints to the F.B.I.; and
Verification of the information supplied on the form through interviews or other investigative techniques.
An applicant may be asked to supplement information originally submitted.

If the Director finds the applicant eligible, the applicant shall be sent another copy of the application form which shall bear a unique registration number. This copy of the application form shall be retained by the applicant as his or her registration certificate.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 23 DCR 8942 (May 6, 1977), incorporating text of the Proposed Rulemaking published at 23 DCR 7061, 7073 (March 4, 1977); 35 DCRR §§313, November 1980, Special Edition.
